Remedial.definition: intended as or providing a remedy b
Remedial.origin: [ treatment of an inmate to improve behavior]

1 a.definition: intended as or providing a remedy

sub_terms.b: concerned with the correction, removal, or abatement of an evil, defect, or disease [ treatment of an inmate to improve behavior] [a workers' compensation claimant who received attention from a doctor] [ a statute correcting the previous law]

2.definition: of, relating to, or being a law enacted for the purpose of providing a method of enforcing an already existing substantive right
